suncertify
Interface ClientToServerConnection

All Superinterfaces:
java.rmi.Remote
All Known Implementing Classes:
RMIClientToServerConnection, StandaloneClientToServerConnection
public interface ClientToServerConnection
extends java.rmi.Remote

The methods that clients can invoke on servers.

Method Summary

          Connect to a server.
 void disconnectFromServer(ServerToClientConnection client)
          Disconnect a client from a server.

          Get the database table schema.

          Perform a search for records matching the specified criteria.

          Change the server database file.
 

Method Detail

connectToServer

java.util.Date connectToServer(ServerToClientConnection client)
                               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Connect to a server. The client is passed as a parameter so that the server has a reference to call the client back with.

Parameters:
client - the client to register with the server
Returns:
the server's current time
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a communication problem

disconnectFromServer

void disconnectFromServer(ServerToClientConnection client)
                          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Disconnect a client from a server.

Parameters:
client - the client to disconnect
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a communication problem

getSchema

TableSchema getSchema()
                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Get the database table schema.

Returns:
the table schema
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a communication problem

getModificationPolicy

RecordModificationPolicy getModificationPolicy()
                                               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Get the modification policy that the server uses to determine if a record is modifiable. This can help the client to decide if a record should be modifiable or not without communicating with the server. If the client decides that a record is modifiable, the server may still veto the modification.

Returns:
the record modification policy
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a communication problem

getFieldParsers

FieldParsers getFieldParsers()
                             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Get the parsers that are used to convert fields to strings and vice versa.

Returns:
the field parsers
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a communication problem

search

int search(ServerToClientConnection client,
           java.util.List<Criterion> criteria,
           boolean onlyShowModifiableRecords)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Perform a search for records matching the specified criteria. This method can be called after connectToServer is called. A null entry in the criteria list will match any value. If criteria is null, all records will be returned. The search results can be obtained with the getSearchResults method.

Parameters:
client - the caller
criteria - the search criteria. Can be null. If not null, the number of items in the list must match the number of fields in the records. Any item in the list may be null (which indicates a wildcard on that field).
onlyShowModifiableRecords - if true, only the modifiable records that match the criteria will be returned. If false, all records that match the criteria will be returned.
Returns:
The number of matching records
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a communication problem

getSearchResults

java.util.List<Record> getSearchResults(ServerToClientConnection client)
                                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Get the next chunk of results of the previous search. The size of the list returned may be smaller than the total number of search results, so this method may need to be called multiple times to get all the search results.

Parameters:
client - the caller
Returns:
A list of Records that match the given criteria.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a communication problem

modifyRecord

void modifyRecord(ServerToClientConnection client,
                  int recordNumber,
                  java.util.List<Field> newFields)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                         RecordNotFoundException,
                         StaleRecordException,
                         RecordNotModifiableException
Modify the specified record. This will fail if the record has been modified in the mean time by another client. The server maintains a timestamp for each record for each client.

Parameters:
client - the caller
recordNumber - the record number of the record to modify
newFields - the new fields to write for the record
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a communication problem
RecordNotFoundException - if the record number does not correspond to a record that is not marked as deleted
StaleRecordException - if the record has been modified without the client's knowledge
RecordNotModifiableException - if the server does not allow the record to be modified

setServerFile

void setServerFile(ProgressListener progressListener,
                   java.lang.String newFileName)
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                          java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                          java.text.ParseException
Change the server database file. This is currently only used in standalone mode.

Parameters:
progressListener - a listener that will be informed of the file parsing progress
newFileName - the filename of the new database file to use
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a communication problem
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file could not be found
java.text.ParseException - if there was a problem parsing the file
